AISuggestion.name: Missing Fin Deployment Control Logic
AISuggestion.description: The model does not capture the actual deployment and retraction mechanism of the fins, only the user command to deploy. The system specification mentions that fins are deployed/retracted by actuators controlled by the controller.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add explicit states for fin deployment/retraction process in ControlUnit or create a separate FinDeployment block with its own state machine that handles the physical movement of fins based on commands

AISuggestion.name: Incomplete Roll Compensation Algorithm
AISuggestion.description: The model does not implement any actual roll compensation algorithm. The controller should compute appropriate fin angles/commands based on roll rate and heeling angle inputs, but only receives these signals without processing them.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add computation logic in ControlUnit to process the received roll_rate and heeling_angle values using a control algorithm (like PID) to generate proper fin commands

AISuggestion.name: Missing Physical Fins Representation
AISuggestion.description: The model does not represent the physical fins themselves. The system specification mentions 'deployable fins located in pairs on both sides of the hull' which should be modeled as actual components.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add separate blocks for Port_Fin and Starboard_Fin with their own attributes (position, angle) and behaviors related to deployment and movement

AISuggestion.name: No Feedback Loop from Fins to Controller
AISuggestion.description: The system specification implies that the controller should be able to monitor fin position/orientation for effective roll compensation, but this feedback path is not modeled.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add feedback signals from fins back to ControlUnit showing actual fin positions/angles to enable closed-loop control

AISuggestion.name: Lack of Environmental Stress Modeling
AISuggestion.description: The model does not capture the environmental stresses that cause rolling, which is central to the system's purpose. The specification mentions 'strong environmental stresses' and 'rolling is the most detrimental'.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add a block representing external forces or disturbance inputs that cause ship rolling, possibly with time-varying components

AISuggestion.name: Incomplete Deployment Process State Machine
AISuggestion.description: The Control_Console deployment process is incomplete - it only sends a command but does not model the actual deployment sequence or status feedback to indicate when fins are fully deployed/retracted.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Extend the Control_Console state machine with states for 'deploying', 'fully_deployed', 'retracting', and 'fully_retracted' along with appropriate signals

AISuggestion.name: No Fins Position Feedback in Controller
AISuggestion.description: The controller should have awareness of actual fin positions to properly calculate commands, but the model only models command sending without feedback about current physical state.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add signals and attributes in ControlUnit to track actual fin position/status rather than just command values

AISuggestion.name: Missing Safety/Status Monitoring
AISuggestion.description: The system should have safety checks and status monitoring for fins (e.g., jamming detection, position limits), which is mentioned implicitly in the specification but not modeled.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add error checking mechanisms and status reporting blocks to monitor fin operation and handle potential failure conditions

AISuggestion.name: Inadequate Sensor Fusion Logic
AISuggestion.description: The system uses both gyrometer (roll rate) and inclinometer (heeling angle), but the model treats them as independent sensors without showing how their data should be combined for decision making.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add logic in ControlUnit to properly integrate both sensor inputs rather than treating them separately

AISuggestion.name: No Emergency Deployment/Retraction Mechanism
AISuggestion.description: The specification mentions 'in extreme cases lead to capsizing' which implies need for emergency deployment/retraction mechanisms that are not modeled.
AISuggestion.howToSolve: Add emergency state handling in ControlUnit and Control_Console for immediate fin action under critical conditions

TURTLEGMODELING.SPECIFICATION: A ship at sea is subject to strong environmental stresses. Among these, rolling is the most detrimental, as it can cause difficulties for the ship to maintain its course, create discomfort for the crew and passengers, damage the cargo due to violent roll/righting movements, and even in extreme cases lead to capsizing. The system we aim to design is intended for roll compensation. It is an active fin stabilizer. Deployable fins are located in pairs on both sides of the hull. The movement of these fins is controlled by actuators, managed by a controller. This controller develops commands based on data received from a gyrometer and an inclinometer, which enable it to detect the ship's rolling movements and heeling. It also generates commands for the retraction and deployment of the fins. For this purpose, the system is equipped with a control console that allows the user to command the retraction or deployment of the fins.

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value:
Suggestions Qwen3 : Missing Fin Deployment Control Logic/Structure: The model does not capture the actual deployment and retraction mechanism of the fins, only the user command to deploy. The system specification mentions that fins are deployed/retracted by actuators controlled by the controller. How to solve? Add explicit states for fin deployment/retraction process in ControlUnit or create a separate FinDeployment block with its own state machine that handles the physical movement of fins based on commands component: ControlUnit
Incomplete Roll Compensation Algorithm/Structure: The model does not implement any actual roll compensation algorithm. The controller should compute appropriate fin angles/commands based on roll rate and heeling angle inputs, but only receives these signals without processing them. How to solve? Add computation logic in ControlUnit to process the received roll_rate and heeling_angle values using a control algorithm (like PID) to generate proper fin commands component: ControlUnit
Missing Physical Fins Representation/Structure: The model does not represent the physical fins themselves. The system specification mentions 'deployable fins located in pairs on both sides of the hull' which should be modeled as actual components. How to solve? Add separate blocks for Port_Fin and Starboard_Fin with their own attributes (position, angle) and behaviors related to deployment and movement component: Actuators
No Feedback Loop from Fins to Controller/Structure: The system specification implies that the controller should be able to monitor fin position/orientation for effective roll compensation, but this feedback path is not modeled. How to solve? Add feedback signals from fins back to ControlUnit showing actual fin positions/angles to enable closed-loop control component: ControlUnit
Lack of Environmental Stress Modeling/Structure: The model does not capture the environmental stresses that cause rolling, which is central to the system's purpose. The specification mentions 'strong environmental stresses' and 'rolling is the most detrimental'. How to solve? Add a block representing external forces or disturbance inputs that cause ship rolling, possibly with time-varying components component: Gyrometer
Incomplete Deployment Process State Machine/Structure: The Control_Console deployment process is incomplete - it only sends a command but does not model the actual deployment sequence or status feedback to indicate when fins are fully deployed/retracted. How to solve? Extend the Control_Console state machine with states for 'deploying', 'fully_deployed', 'retracting', and 'fully_retracted' along with appropriate signals component: Control_Console
No Fins Position Feedback in Controller/Structure: The controller should have awareness of actual fin positions to properly calculate commands, but the model only models command sending without feedback about current physical state. How to solve? Add signals and attributes in ControlUnit to track actual fin position/status rather than just command values component: ControlUnit
Missing Safety/Status Monitoring/Structure: The system should have safety checks and status monitoring for fins (e.g., jamming detection, position limits), which is mentioned implicitly in the specification but not modeled. How to solve? Add error checking mechanisms and status reporting blocks to monitor fin operation and handle potential failure conditions component: Actuators
Inadequate Sensor Fusion Logic/Structure: The system uses both gyrometer (roll rate) and inclinometer (heeling angle), but the model treats them as independent sensors without showing how their data should be combined for decision making. How to solve? Add logic in ControlUnit to properly integrate both sensor inputs rather than treating them separately component: ControlUnit
No Emergency Deployment/Retraction Mechanism/Structure: The specification mentions 'in extreme cases lead to capsizing' which implies need for emergency deployment/retraction mechanisms that are not modeled. How to solve? Add emergency state handling in ControlUnit and Control_Console for immediate fin action under critical conditions component: ControlUnit

How to solve? Extend the Control_Console state machine with states for 'deploying', 'fully_deployed', 'retracting', and 'fully_retracted' along with appropriate signals component: Control_Console

How to solve? Add signals and attributes in ControlUnit to track actual fin position/status rather than just command values component: ControlUnit

How to solve? Add logic in ControlUnit to properly integrate both sensor inputs rather than treating them separately component: ControlUnit

No Emergency Deployment/Retraction Mechanism/Structure: The specification mentions 'in extreme cases lead to capsizing' which implies need for emergency deployment/retraction mechanisms that are not modeled. How to solve? Add emergency state handling in ControlUnit and Control_Console for immediate fin action under critical conditions component: ControlUnit

infoparam.name: UML Note
infoparam.value:
Suggestions GPT-OSS : Add Ship Dynamics/Structure: The model lacks a representation of the ship’s roll dynamics (mass, inertia, damping). Without this, controller tuning cannot be validated. How to solve? Introduce a new block "ShipDynamics" with attributes for mass, moment_of_inertia, and damping_coefficient. Provide a state machine that updates roll_angle based on roll_rate input from the Gyrometer. component: Gyrometer
Model Sensor Noise/Structure: Inclinometer and Gyrometer outputs are deterministic; real sensors have noise that affects control stability. How to solve? Add stochastic perturbation to the sensor signal generation step (e.g., Gaussian noise) and expose a "noise_level" attribute for each sensor block. component: Gyrometer
Define Fin Deployment Limits/Structure: No constraints are defined on the fin angles; unrealistic extreme values could be commanded. How to solve? Add attributes "min_angle" and "max_angle" to Actuators and enforce them in the ControlUnit before sending commands. component: Actuators
Include Actuator Dynamics/Structure: The actuator block instantly applies finCommand; real actuators have time constants and saturation limits. How to solve? Implement a simple first‑order lag model in Actuators, with attributes for response_time and current_angle. Update the angle gradually toward target command. component: Actuators
Specify Controller Algorithm/Structure: The ControlUnit’s computingCommand state is empty; no control law is defined. How to solve? Insert a PID or LQR controller logic that uses roll_rate and heeling_angle to compute port_fin_command and starboard_fin_command. Provide tunable parameters as attributes. component: ControlUnit
Add Safety Interlocks/Structure: There is no mechanism to prevent fin deployment when the ship is near capsizing or during maintenance. How to solve? Create a SafetyBlock that monitors roll_angle and disables deploymentOrder if |roll_angle| exceeds a threshold. Connect its output to ControlUnit’s deploy flag. component: ControlUnit
Model Fin Deployment Sequence/Structure: The model does not represent the mechanical sequence of retracting/ deploying fins before commanding fin angles. How to solve? Add a sub‑state machine inside Actuators that first moves fins to the retracted position, waits for confirmation, then applies commanded angles. component: Actuators
Include Power Consumption/Structure: The system specification does not mention power constraints but in practice actuator and controller consume energy. How to solve? Add a PowerBlock with attributes for current_draw of Actuators and ControlUnit. Add logic to throttle fin movement if battery level is low. component: Actuators
Model Communication Delays/Structure: Signals between blocks are instantaneous; realistic delays can affect control performance. How to solve? Introduce a Delay component or add delay attributes to signal transitions (e.g., DeploymentOrderDelay). Use these in state machines before processing signals. component: ControlUnit
Add Validation of Deployment Orders/Structure: The ControlConsole can send any boolean value; no validation against current fin state. How to solve? Implement a check in ControlUnit that compares requested deploy flag with current fin position and ignores redundant commands. component: ControlUnit

Line.value: Suggestions GPT-OSS :

Add Ship Dynamics/Structure: The model lacks a representation of the ship’s roll dynamics (mass, inertia, damping). Without this, controller tuning cannot be validated. How to solve? Introduce a new block "ShipDynamics" with attributes for mass, moment_of_inertia, and damping_coefficient. Provide a state machine that updates roll_angle based on roll_rate input from the Gyrometer. component: Gyrometer

Model Sensor Noise/Structure: Inclinometer and Gyrometer outputs are deterministic; real sensors have noise that affects control stability. How to solve? Add stochastic perturbation to the sensor signal generation step (e.g., Gaussian noise) and expose a "noise_level" attribute for each sensor block. component: Gyrometer

Define Fin Deployment Limits/Structure: No constraints are defined on the fin angles; unrealistic extreme values could be commanded. How to solve? Add attributes "min_angle" and "max_angle" to Actuators and enforce them in the ControlUnit before sending commands. component: Actuators

Include Actuator Dynamics/Structure: The actuator block instantly applies finCommand; real actuators have time constants and saturation limits. How to solve? Implement a simple first‑order lag model in Actuators, with attributes for response_time and current_angle. Update the angle gradually toward target command. component: Actuators

Specify Controller Algorithm/Structure: The ControlUnit’s computingCommand state is empty; no control law is defined. How to solve? Insert a PID or LQR controller logic that uses roll_rate and heeling_angle to compute port_fin_command and starboard_fin_command. Provide tunable parameters as attributes. component: ControlUnit

Add Safety Interlocks/Structure: There is no mechanism to prevent fin deployment when the ship is near capsizing or during maintenance. How to solve? Create a SafetyBlock that monitors roll_angle and disables deploymentOrder if |roll_angle| exceeds a threshold. Connect its output to ControlUnit’s deploy flag. component: ControlUnit

Model Fin Deployment Sequence/Structure: The model does not represent the mechanical sequence of retracting/ deploying fins before commanding fin angles. How to solve? Add a sub‑state machine inside Actuators that first moves fins to the retracted position, waits for confirmation, then applies commanded angles. component: Actuators

Include Power Consumption/Structure: The system specification does not mention power constraints but in practice actuator and controller consume energy. How to solve? Add a PowerBlock with attributes for current_draw of Actuators and ControlUnit. Add logic to throttle fin movement if battery level is low. component: Actuators

Model Communication Delays/Structure: Signals between blocks are instantaneous; realistic delays can affect control performance. How to solve? Introduce a Delay component or add delay attributes to signal transitions (e.g., DeploymentOrderDelay). Use these in state machines before processing signals. component: ControlUnit

Add Validation of Deployment Orders/Structure: The ControlConsole can send any boolean value; no validation against current fin state. How to solve? Implement a check in ControlUnit that compares requested deploy flag with current fin position and ignores redundant commands. component: ControlUnit
